article.title: Integration with Spring Security
article.para: If you are using the Springframework with Acegi Security or Spring Security, you don't have to follow the chapter Getting started with JPA Security (also you can do and specify the net.sf.jpasecurity.security.authentication.AcegiAuthenticationProvider or net.sf.jpasecurity.security.authentication.SpringAuthenticationProvider in your persistence.properties).

The easiest way to integrate Spring-Security is to simply replace your LocalEntityManagerFactoryBean or LocalContainerEntityManagerFactoryBean in your Spring configuration with the appropriate counterpart in the net.sf.jpasecurity.persistence package (which are SecureLocalEntityManagerFactoryBean and SecureContainerEntityManagerFactoryBean).

If you are using Acegi-Security instead of Spring-Security you have to set the net.sf.jpasecurity.security.authentication.AcegiAuthenticationProvider into the authenticationProvider property of your SecureEntityManagerFactoryBean in your application context.
